title.narrative: PROFESSIONALS INCREASED KNOWLEDGE & SKIL

description.narrative: By 2021, professionals working with adolescents have increased knowledge, skills and tools to provide a package of services that promote key behaviours to prevent HIV and other STIs, non-communicable diseases, adolescent pregnancy and promote physical and mental development., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, all adolescents, especially the disadvantaged, increasingly practice key behaviours for healthy development and participate in decision-making at all levels to accelerate the realisation of their rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, professionals working with adolescents have increased knowledge, skills and tools to provide a package of services thatpromote key behaviours to prevent HIV and other STIs, non-communicable diseases, adolescent pregnancy and promote physical andmental development.

description.narrative: Increased skills and institutional capacity achieved with the rollout of the HERO mental health screening application in 1,077 schools and training of 341 nurses at 200 hospitals. 124 DJOP officials trained on standards for youth participation. National guidelines for the provision of pre-exposure prophylaxis and a new education curriculum for young people in juvenile detention were finalised. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2022
